meanings.definition: To load or put a load on (something)
meanings.sent1: She onloads the groceries into the car.
meanings.sent2: He always onloads the boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: The robot onloads the items with precision and speed.
meanings.sent4: The workers onloads the supplies like ants carrying food to their nest.
meanings.sent5: Onloading the luggage felt like lifting a mountain.

meanings.definition: The act of loading or putting a load on something
meanings.sent1: The onloads of bricks caused the truck to sag.
meanings.sent2: The onloads of books made the shelves bend.
meanings.sent3: The onloads of presents made the tree look like a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The onloads of memories filled her heart to the brim.
meanings.sent5: The onloads of work felt like a heavy burden on his shoulders.
